page.title: 05HOP GROWING
page.content:
The land to the North of the A31 is an outcrop of the{Upper Greensand}and has been used since about 1600 for quite intensive hop production. Grown in {"Gardens"}protected by tall handsome quickset hedges with their trellis of poles and wires that dominated the landscape. Within the last ten years the acreage under hops, has rapidly declined, due largely to the increasing production of chemical beers. The once hop gardens are now used for cereals or rape seed with cattle and sheep on the managed grassland.
The history of this interesting crop is well recorded and exhibited in the {Curtis Museum in Alton.}
